leaf_cluster.leaf_cluster_name: 计算系统生物学与动力学生态
leaf_cluster.typical_objects: ODE/PDE 模型, 代谢网络, 信号通路, 参数与不确定性
leaf_cluster.task_chain: 建模→参数估计→仿真→敏感性/UQ→反演→验证
leaf_cluster.tool_form: 建模语言/仿真器 + 参数估计/UQ + 数据拟合工作流

unit.unit_name: 代谢网络与约束建模（FBA等）

tools.name: AMICI
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance sensitivity analysis for large ODE models
tools.detailed_description: AMICI provides a multi-language (Python, C++, Matlab) interface for the SUNDIALS solver suite, optimized for sensitivity analysis of large-scale ordinary differential equation (ODE) models in systems biology.

tools.name: AutoKEGGRec
tools.one_line_profile: Automated metabolic network reconstruction from KEGG data
tools.detailed_description: AutoKEGGRec automates the creation of draft metabolic network reconstructions for single organisms or communities based on KEGG database information.

tools.name: sbmltoodepy
tools.one_line_profile: Converter for SBML models to Python ODE implementations
tools.detailed_description: A tool that parses SBML files and generates Python code to simulate the model using ordinary differential equations, facilitating model simulation and analysis in Python environments.

tools.name: EFMlrs
tools.one_line_profile: Elementary Flux Mode calculation workflow
tools.detailed_description: A Python package and workflow for calculating Elementary Flux Modes (EFMs) in metabolic networks using (mp)lrs and efmtool backends.

tools.name: Benchmark-Models-PEtab
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark collection for parameter estimation in systems biology
tools.detailed_description: A curated collection of mathematical models and experimental data in the PEtab format, serving as benchmark problems for evaluating data-based modeling methodologies.

tools.name: PathSBML
tools.one_line_profile: PathVisio plugin for SBML to SBGN-PD visualization
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for PathVisio that allows importing SBML models and visualizing them as SBGN Process Description (SBGN-PD) diagrams.

tools.name: MEWpy
tools.one_line_profile: Metabolic Engineering Workbench for optimization and simulation
tools.detailed_description: A framework for metabolic engineering that integrates constraint-based modeling with optimization algorithms to identify gene knockout/overexpression strategies.

tools.name: cobamp
tools.one_line_profile: Constraint-based analysis of metabolic pathways
tools.detailed_description: A framework for the enumeration and analysis of pathway concepts (like elementary flux modes or minimal cut sets) in metabolic networks.

tools.name: subsbml
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for managing subsystems in SBML models
tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed to create, manipulate, and combine subsystems of SBML models, facilitating modular modeling in systems biology.

tools.name: DeltaFBA
tools.one_line_profile: Flux balance analysis using differential gene expression
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB toolbox that integrates differential gene expression data with constraint-based modeling to evaluate intracellular flux distribution changes between conditions.

tools.name: tuatara
tools.one_line_profile: Manager for genome-scale metabolic model reconstruction
tools.detailed_description: A tool to reconstruct and handle multiple genome-scale metabolic models within the ScrumPy environment, aiding in the curation and analysis of metabolic networks.

tools.name: fasterfva
tools.one_line_profile: Accelerated Flux Variability Analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool designed to perform Flux Variability Analysis (FVA) significantly faster than standard implementations, useful for large-scale metabolic models.

tools.name: SBO
tools.one_line_profile: Systems Biology Ontology
tools.detailed_description: The Systems Biology Ontology (SBO) provides controlled vocabularies and relationships for terms used in computational modeling of biological systems.

tools.name: Haskell-MFAPipe-Executable
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel labeling steady state metabolic flux analysis
tools.detailed_description: An open-source software pipeline for performing steady-state metabolic flux analysis (MFA) with support for parallel processing of labeling data.

tools.name: remind
tools.one_line_profile: Reconstruction of metabolic interactions in microbial communities
tools.detailed_description: A tool for inferring metabolic interaction networks within microbial communities by utilizing genome-scale metabolic models.

tools.name: FastMM
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient toolbox for constraint-based metabolic modeling
tools.detailed_description: An ultra-efficient C-based toolbox for performing constraint-based metabolic modeling tasks such as Flux Balance Analysis.

tools.name: cobra-app
tools.one_line_profile: Web application for Flux Balance Analysis
tools.detailed_description: A web-based interface for running Flux Balance Analysis (FBA) on metabolic models, making constraint-based modeling accessible via a browser.

tools.name: parPE
tools.one_line_profile: HPC-ready parameter estimation for dynamical models
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library for high-performance parameter estimation of ODE models, supporting batch optimization and dynamic load balancing for large-scale systems.

tools.name: bayflux
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian genome-scale 13C Metabolic Flux Analysis
tools.detailed_description: A software tool for performing Bayesian inference on genome-scale 13C Metabolic Flux Analysis (MFA) problems, incorporating uncertainty quantification.

tools.name: COBREXA.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Exascale-ready constraint-based reconstruction and analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package for scalable constraint-based reconstruction and analysis of metabolic models, designed for high-performance computing environments.

tools.name: FBCModelTests.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Test suite for constraint-based metabolic models
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package providing a suite of tests to validate the consistency and quality of constraint-based metabolic models (FBC models).

tools.name: pyvipr
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization widget for systems biology models
tools.detailed_description: A Jupyter widget for the static and dynamic visualization of systems biology models written in PySB, BNGL, and SBML formats.

tools.name: Automated-MFA-2023
tools.one_line_profile: Automated metabolic flux analysis package
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance Python package designed to automate the process of metabolic flux analysis (MFA), streamlining the workflow from data to flux estimation.

tools.name: DNNGIOR
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning guided gapfilling for metabolic models
tools.detailed_description: Scripts that utilize a deep neural network to predict missing reactions (gapfilling) in genome-scale metabolic models, improving model quality.

tools.name: miom
tools.one_line_profile: Mixed Integer Optimization for metabolic modeling
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool for constraint-based modeling of metabolism that leverages Mixed Integer Optimization (MIO) to solve complex metabolic problems.

tools.name: MetabolicAtlas
tools.one_line_profile: Repository of genome-scale metabolic models
tools.detailed_description: An open-source collection and platform for genome-scale metabolic models of humans and model animals, serving as a reference dataset for systems biology.

tools.name: ModelSEED-UI
tools.one_line_profile: User interface for ModelSEED
tools.detailed_description: The web-based user interface for the ModelSEED platform, which enables the reconstruction, annotation, and analysis of metabolic models.

tools.name: ModelSEEDDatabase
tools.one_line_profile: Biochemistry database for ModelSEED reconstructions
tools.detailed_description: The definitive database of biochemistry and metadata used by the ModelSEED framework to construct and annotate genome-scale metabolic models.

tools.name: ModelSEEDpy
tools.one_line_profile: Python package for building and analyzing metabolic models using the ModelSEED biochemistry database
tools.detailed_description: ModelSEEDpy is a Python package designed to interface with the ModelSEED biochemistry database and reconstruction pipeline. It facilitates the construction, gap-filling, and analysis of genome-scale metabolic models, integrating with the KBase platform.

tools.name: PlantSEED
tools.one_line_profile: Plant-specific metabolic modeling subsystem for the ModelSEED environment
tools.detailed_description: PlantSEED contains the code and data structures necessary for the reconstruction and analysis of plant metabolic models within the ModelSEED framework. It addresses the specific complexities of plant metabolism.

tools.name: iBioSim
tools.one_line_profile: CAD tool for the modeling, analysis, and design of genetic circuits
tools.detailed_description: iBioSim is a computer-aided design (CAD) tool for synthetic biology. It supports the modeling, analysis, and design of genetic circuits, capable of importing/exporting SBML and SBOL standards, and performing stochastic and deterministic simulations.

tools.name: JSim
tools.one_line_profile: Java-based simulation system for physiology and biomedicine
tools.detailed_description: JSim is a simulation system for building quantitative numeric models and analyzing them against experimental data. While general, it is primarily focused on physiology and biomedicine (Physiome project).

tools.name: flux-data-qaqc
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for energy balance closure analysis and eddy flux data post-processing
tools.detailed_description: This Python package provides tools for Quality Assurance and Quality Control (QAQC) of eddy covariance flux data, including energy balance closure analysis, which is critical for ecological and environmental studies.

tools.name: flux-ratio-based-gibbs-energy
tools.one_line_profile: Determination of reaction free energy via metabolic flux analysis
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB tool to determine the free energy of reactions and their confidence intervals using metabolic flux analysis and optimization techniques. It integrates thermodynamics with flux analysis.

tools.name: FastSL
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB toolbox for rapid evaluation of synthetic lethal sets in metabolic models
tools.detailed_description: FastSL is a MATLAB toolbox designed to rapidly identify synthetic lethal gene or reaction sets in genome-scale metabolic models. It is useful for identifying potential drug targets in pathogens or cancer cells.

tools.name: gsmodutils
tools.one_line_profile: Utility framework for the management of genome-scale metabolic models
tools.detailed_description: gsmodutils provides a set of utilities for managing, curating, and validating genome-scale metabolic models (GEMs). It assists in the standardization and quality control of metabolic network reconstructions.

tools.name: Recon3D
tools.one_line_profile: A 3-Dimensional view of human metabolism and disease model
tools.detailed_description: Recon3D is a genome-scale metabolic model of humans that integrates metabolic network data with 3D protein structure information. It enables the analysis of metabolic variations and disease states in a structural context.

tools.name: cobradb
tools.one_line_profile: Relational database loader for genome-scale metabolic models
tools.detailed_description: COBRAdb is a tool to load genome-scale metabolic models and genome annotations into a relational database. It serves as the backend for BiGG Models, facilitating the storage, querying, and distribution of metabolic models.

tools.name: cobrame
tools.one_line_profile: COBRApy extension for models of metabolism and expression (ME-models)
tools.detailed_description: cobrame is a Python package that extends COBRApy to support the construction and analysis of ME-models (Metabolism and Expression models). These models account for the proteome allocation constraints in addition to metabolic fluxes.

tools.name: ecolime
tools.one_line_profile: Tools and data for the E. coli K-12 ME-model iJL1678b-ME
tools.detailed_description: ecolime contains the specific data and scripts required to build the iJL1678b-ME model of E. coli K-12. It works in conjunction with cobrame to generate this specific organism-scale model.

tools.name: ssbio
tools.one_line_profile: Python framework for structural systems biology
tools.detailed_description: ssbio is a Python framework designed to work with genome-scale models and protein structures. It provides tools to map protein structures to metabolic models, analyze structural properties, and visualize results.

tools.name: SBMLToolkit.jl
tools.one_line_profile: SBML model importer for Julia's SciML ecosystem
tools.detailed_description: SBMLToolkit.jl allows users to import SBML (Systems Biology Markup Language) models into the Julia SciML ecosystem (ModelingToolkit.jl). It enables high-performance simulation and analysis of biological models using Julia's differential equation solvers.

tools.name: DLKcat
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning tool for enzyme turnover number (kcat) prediction
tools.detailed_description: DLKcat uses deep learning and Bayesian approaches to predict enzyme turnover numbers (kcat) from protein sequences and substrate information. This data is crucial for improving enzyme-constrained genome-scale metabolic models (ecGEMs).

tools.name: Human-GEM
tools.one_line_profile: Generic genome-scale metabolic model of Homo sapiens
tools.detailed_description: Human-GEM is a comprehensive, community-curated genome-scale metabolic model of humans. It serves as a central repository and tool for studying human metabolism, disease mechanisms, and personalized medicine.

tools.name: MuscleATPProductionSimulation
tools.one_line_profile: Models and simulation scripts for muscle ATP production
tools.detailed_description: This repository contains enzyme-constrained stoichiometric models and scripts for simulating ATP production in muscle fibers. It includes both small-scale and whole-body metabolic models for studying muscle metabolism.

tools.name: RAVEN Toolbox
tools.one_line_profile: Toolbox for genome scale model reconstruction, curation and analysis
tools.detailed_description: RAVEN (Reconstruction, Analysis and Visualization of Metabolic Networks) is a MATLAB toolbox for genome-scale metabolic model reconstruction, curation, and analysis. It supports automated reconstruction from homology and constraint-based modeling.

tools.name: SingleCellModeling
tools.one_line_profile: Workflow for generating context-specific metabolic models from scRNA-seq data
tools.detailed_description: This repository provides the code and workflow for generating and analyzing context-specific genome-scale metabolic models derived from single-cell RNA-Seq data, enabling the study of metabolic heterogeneity at the single-cell level.

tools.name: hanpo-GEM
tools.one_line_profile: Genome-scale metabolic model of Hansenula polymorpha
tools.detailed_description: hanpo-GEM is a genome-scale metabolic model for the yeast Hansenula polymorpha (Ogataea polymorpha). It is used for simulating metabolism and guiding metabolic engineering efforts in this organism.

tools.name: cbmpy
tools.one_line_profile: Python platform for constraint based modelling and analysis
tools.detailed_description: CBMPy is a Python-based platform for constraint-based modeling (CBM) of biological networks. It supports Flux Balance Analysis (FBA), Flux Variability Analysis (FVA), and other network analysis methods.

tools.name: dynamic-community-fba
tools.one_line_profile: Dynamic Flux Balance Analysis for microbial communities
tools.detailed_description: This repository implements Dynamic Community FBA, a method for simulating the dynamic interactions and growth of microbial communities using flux balance analysis over time.

tools.name: CobraMod
tools.one_line_profile: Package for modifying and extending genome-scale metabolic models
tools.detailed_description: CobraMod is a Python package that simplifies the process of modifying genome-scale metabolic models. It allows users to easily add new pathways from databases or curated datasets to existing models.

tools.name: cobrar
tools.one_line_profile: Constraint-based Reconstruction and Analysis (COBRA) in R
tools.detailed_description: cobrar provides an R implementation for Constraint-based Reconstruction and Analysis (COBRA) of metabolic networks. It enables R users to perform flux balance analysis and other metabolic network analyses.

tools.name: Growth-coupling-suite
tools.one_line_profile: Workflow for computing microbial strain designs coupling target reaction to growth
tools.detailed_description: A constraint-based metabolic modeling workflow designed to compute and analyze microbial strain designs. It focuses on coupling a target reaction to cellular growth, facilitating metabolic engineering strategies.

tools.name: cameo
tools.one_line_profile: Computer Aided Metabolic Engineering & Optimization library
tools.detailed_description: A high-level Python library for metabolic engineering and optimization. It provides a modular framework for simulation, analysis, and design of metabolic models, supporting various constraint-based methods.

tools.name: incawrapper
tools.one_line_profile: Python wrapper for Metabolic Flux Analysis (MFA) using INCA
tools.detailed_description: A Python wrapper that provides an interface to INCA (Isotopomer Network Compartmental Analysis), facilitating Metabolic Flux Analysis (MFA) workflows and adding additional functionalities for data handling.

tools.name: multitfa
tools.one_line_profile: Multivariate thermodynamics-based metabolic flux analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for performing multivariate thermodynamics-based metabolic flux analysis (TFA). It integrates thermodynamic constraints into metabolic models to improve flux prediction accuracy.

tools.name: CarveMe
tools.one_line_profile: Automated reconstruction of genome-scale metabolic models
tools.detailed_description: A command-line tool for the automated reconstruction of genome-scale metabolic models for microbial species and communities. It uses a top-down approach to 'carve' models from a universal template.

tools.name: CNApy
tools.one_line_profile: Integrated visual environment for metabolic modeling
tools.detailed_description: A desktop application providing an integrated visual environment for metabolic modeling. It supports Flux Balance Analysis (FBA), Flux Variability Analysis (FVA), Elementary Flux Modes (EFM), and other advanced metabolic network analysis methods.

tools.name: EscherConverter
tools.one_line_profile: Converter for Escher visualization files to community standards
tools.detailed_description: A standalone Java program that converts files created with the Escher graphical network editor into community standard formats (SBML, SBGN, etc.), facilitating interoperability in metabolic modeling.

tools.name: ModelPolisher
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to annotate SBML models using BiGG Models knowledgebase
tools.detailed_description: A tool that automatically annotates and curates SBML models by accessing the BiGG Models knowledgebase. It helps improve model quality and compliance with standards.

tools.name: SBML2LaTeX
tools.one_line_profile: Converter from SBML models to LaTeX reports
tools.detailed_description: A tool to convert Systems Biology Markup Language (SBML) files into human-readable LaTeX reports (PDF/TeX). It aids in model documentation, error detection, and communication.

tools.name: SBMLme
tools.one_line_profile: Library for encoding ME models in SBML
tools.detailed_description: A Java library for encoding Metabolism and Expression (ME) models using the SBML standard. It supports the representation of complex macromolecular synthesis processes.

tools.name: SBSCL
tools.one_line_profile: Systems Biology Simulation Core Library
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive Java library for interpreting and solving models encoded in SBML. It provides efficient numerical methods for simulating biological systems.

tools.name: pymCADRE
tools.one_line_profile: Reconstruction of tissue-specific metabolic models
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of the mCADRE algorithm for reconstructing tissue-specific metabolic models using transcriptomic data and network topology information.

tools.name: refineGEMs
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for curation of genome-scale metabolic models
tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed to assist in the curation and quality improvement of genome-scale metabolic models (GEMs), offering various checks and refinement functions.

tools.name: reconstructor
tools.one_line_profile: Automated GENRE building tool from gene fastas
tools.detailed_description: A COBRApy-compatible tool for automated Genome-Scale Metabolic Network Reconstruction (GENRE) building. It creates models directly from gene FASTA files based on KEGG annotations.

tools.name: metabolic-allele-classifiers
tools.one_line_profile: Machine learning classifier for microbial GWAS using flux balance analysis
tools.detailed_description: A tool that integrates flux balance analysis (FBA) with machine learning to classify metabolic alleles for microbial Genome-Wide Association Studies (GWAS).

tools.name: CoReCo
tools.one_line_profile: Comparative reconstruction of genome-scale metabolic networks
tools.detailed_description: A computational method and tool for the comparative reconstruction of genome-scale metabolic networks, enabling the generation of models based on phylogenetic information.

tools.name: spatial-sbml
tools.one_line_profile: Libraries and tools for spatial simulation of SBML models
tools.detailed_description: A set of libraries and tools designed to support the spatial simulation of biological models encoded in the Systems Biology Markup Language (SBML).

tools.name: Flint
tools.one_line_profile: Simulator for biological and physiological models
tools.detailed_description: A simulator supporting PHML and SBML formats for running biological and physiological simulations, developed in the context of the Physiome project.

tools.name: metaGEM
tools.one_line_profile: Workflow for generating context-specific genome-scale metabolic models from metagenomics
tools.detailed_description: An integrated workflow for reconstructing genome-scale metabolic models (GEMs) directly from metagenomic data and predicting metabolic interactions within microbial communities.

tools.name: mfapy
tools.one_line_profile: Python toolbox for 13C metabolic flux analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for performing 13C-based Metabolic Flux Analysis (13C-MFA), supporting model construction, simulation, and flux estimation.

tools.name: g2f
tools.one_line_profile: R package for gap-filling metabolic networks
tools.detailed_description: An R package designed to identify and fill gaps in metabolic networks using stoichiometric reactions from reference reconstructions and weighting functions.

tools.name: INDRA
tools.one_line_profile: Integrated Network and Dynamical Reasoning Assembler
tools.detailed_description: An automated model assembly system that interfaces with NLP systems and databases to collect knowledge and produce causal graphs and dynamical models for systems biology.

tools.name: D-VASim
tools.one_line_profile: Dynamic Virtual Analyzer and Simulator for genetic logic circuits
tools.detailed_description: A simulation and analysis tool for genetic logic circuit models encoded in SBML, enabling the verification of dynamic behavior in synthetic biology designs.

tools.name: cobra-ai
tools.one_line_profile: Toolbox of interpretable VAE models for COBRA
tools.detailed_description: A toolbox providing interpretable Variational Autoencoder (VAE) models tailored for Constraint-Based Reconstruction and Analysis (COBRA) data.

tools.name: Newt
tools.one_line_profile: Web application to visualize and edit pathway models
tools.detailed_description: A web-based editor and visualizer for biological pathway models, supporting standards like SBGN (Systems Biology Graphical Notation).

tools.name: BOFdat
tools.one_line_profile: Generate biomass objective functions from experimental data
tools.detailed_description: A tool to generate biomass objective function stoichiometric coefficients for genome-scale metabolic models using experimental data inputs.

tools.name: surfin_fba
tools.one_line_profile: Dynamic FBA for use with COBRApy metabolic models
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for performing dynamic Flux Balance Analysis (dFBA) simulations, integrated with the COBRApy framework.

tools.name: gapseq
tools.one_line_profile: Prediction and analysis of bacterial metabolic pathways and networks
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive tool for the informed prediction of bacterial metabolic pathways and the reconstruction of genome-scale metabolic networks from genome sequences.

tools.name: PanGEM
tools.one_line_profile: Pangenome-scale metabolic network reconstruction and analysis
tools.detailed_description: A workflow for reconstructing pangenome-scale metabolic networks and extracting strain-specific models, enabling analysis of metabolic diversity.

tools.name: FBA-pipeline
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for generation and simulation of personalized FBA models
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline designed to generate and simulate personalized Flux Balance Analysis models, likely for biomedical applications.

tools.name: FluxGAT
tools.one_line_profile: Graph Neural Network for predicting gene essentiality from flux data
tools.detailed_description: A Graph Neural Network (GNN) model that predicts gene essentiality by utilizing graphical representations derived from flux sampling data, reducing reliance on objective functions.

tools.name: autopacmen
tools.one_line_profile: Adds protein allocation constraints to metabolic models (sMOMENT)
tools.detailed_description: A tool that retrieves kcat data and automatically adds protein allocation constraints to stoichiometric metabolic models following the sMOMENT method.

tools.name: StrainDesign
tools.one_line_profile: Computational design of metabolic networks based on COBRApy
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for the computational design of metabolic networks (strain design), built upon the COBRApy framework.

tools.name: PyBNF
tools.one_line_profile: Parameterization of biological models in SBML and BNGL formats
tools.detailed_description: An application for the parameterization and optimization of biological models (SBML, BNGL) using parallelization and metaheuristic algorithms.

tools.name: Raven
tools.one_line_profile: De novo genome assembler for long uncorrected reads
tools.detailed_description: Raven is a de novo genome assembler specifically designed for long uncorrected reads (such as those from Oxford Nanopore or PacBio). It optimizes the assembly process to handle high error rates in long-read sequencing data.

tools.name: LibSBMLSim
tools.one_line_profile: Library for simulating SBML models
tools.detailed_description: LibSBMLSim is a C library designed to simulate biological models encoded in the Systems Biology Markup Language (SBML). It supports the simulation of Ordinary Differential Equations (ODEs) defined within SBML files.

tools.name: PyFBA
tools.one_line_profile: Python implementation of flux balance analysis
tools.detailed_description: PyFBA is a Python package for flux balance analysis (FBA) to model microbial metabolism. It allows users to build models from genomes, gap-fill them, and run FBA simulations.

tools.name: mergem
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for merging and comparing genome-scale metabolic models
tools.detailed_description: Mergem is a command-line tool and Python package for merging, comparing, and translating genome-scale metabolic models (GEMs), facilitating the integration of different metabolic reconstructions.

tools.name: bamfa
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian metabolic flux analysis
tools.detailed_description: BAMFA implements Bayesian metabolic flux analysis, allowing for the estimation of metabolic fluxes with uncertainty quantification using Bayesian inference methods.

tools.name: dfba
tools.one_line_profile: Encoding Dynamic Flux Balance Analysis in SBML
tools.detailed_description: This tool provides methods and specifications for encoding Dynamic Flux Balance Analysis (dFBA) problems directly within the SBML format, facilitating the standardization of dynamic metabolic modeling.

tools.name: fbc_curation
tools.one_line_profile: FROG analysis for reproducibility of FBC models
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool for performing FROG (Flux Balance Analysis Reproducibility of Models) analysis, ensuring the reproducibility and quality control of Flux Balance Constraints (FBC) models.

tools.name: neo4sbml
tools.one_line_profile: Neo4j representation of SBML model components
tools.detailed_description: Neo4sbml enables the import and representation of SBML model components and annotations into a Neo4j graph database, facilitating complex queries and network analysis of metabolic models.

tools.name: scobra
tools.one_line_profile: Extension of cobrapy for metabolic modeling
tools.detailed_description: Scobra is a Python package that extends COBRApy, providing additional functionality and simplified interfaces for constraint-based reconstruction and analysis of metabolic networks.

tools.name: fbar
tools.one_line_profile: Flux Balance Analysis package with a tidy data approach
tools.detailed_description: fbar is an R package for Flux Balance Analysis that emphasizes a 'tidy data' approach, making it easier to integrate metabolic modeling into data analysis pipelines in R.

tools.name: aspefm
tools.one_line_profile: Computing Elementary Flux Modes with Answer Set Programming
tools.detailed_description: aspefm uses Answer Set Programming (ASP) to compute Elementary Flux Modes (EFMs) in metabolic networks, offering an alternative logic-based approach to pathway analysis.

tools.name: metaRange
tools.one_line_profile: Mechanistic & metabolic constrained species range simulations
tools.detailed_description: metaRange is an R package for simulating species ranges by integrating mechanistic and metabolic constraints, bridging ecology and metabolic modeling.

tools.name: MICOM
tools.one_line_profile: Metabolic modeling of microbial communities
tools.detailed_description: MICOM is a Python package for the metabolic modeling of microbial communities. It allows for the integration of metagenomic data to simulate the metabolic interactions within microbiomes.

tools.name: Riptide
tools.one_line_profile: Reaction Inclusion by Parsimony and Transcript Distribution
tools.detailed_description: Riptide is a tool for creating context-specific metabolic models by integrating transcriptomic data with genome-scale metabolic networks using a parsimonious approach.

tools.name: Mackinac
tools.one_line_profile: Bridge between ModelSEED and COBRApy
tools.detailed_description: Mackinac serves as a bridge library connecting ModelSEED (a resource for metabolic models) and COBRApy, facilitating the use of ModelSEED models within the COBRApy environment.

tools.name: FluxML
tools.one_line_profile: Universal Modeling Language for Metabolic Flux Analysis
tools.detailed_description: FluxML defines a standardized modeling language for Metabolic Flux Analysis (MFA) and provides tools for parsing and processing these models.

tools.name: tEFMA
tools.one_line_profile: Thermodynamically feasible elementary flux modes calculator
tools.detailed_description: tEFMA is a tool for calculating elementary flux modes (EFMs) that are thermodynamically feasible, integrating thermodynamic constraints into pathway analysis.

tools.name: swiftcore
tools.one_line_profile: Accelerated genome-scale metabolic network reconstruction
tools.detailed_description: Swiftcore implements convex optimization techniques to significantly accelerate the reconstruction of genome-scale metabolic networks, focusing on performance improvements for large-scale models.

tools.name: fishualize
tools.one_line_profile: Color scales and silhouettes for plotting fish in R
tools.detailed_description: Fishualize is an R package providing scientifically accurate silhouettes and color scales based on teleost fishes, used for enhancing biological data visualization.

tools.name: COBRA.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Constraint-based reconstruction and analysis in Julia
tools.detailed_description: COBRA.jl is the Julia implementation of the COBRA toolbox, providing high-performance tools for constraint-based reconstruction and analysis of metabolic networks.

tools.name: Medusa
tools.one_line_profile: Analysis of ensembles of metabolic network reconstructions
tools.detailed_description: Medusa is a Python package for generating and analyzing ensembles of genome-scale metabolic network reconstructions, allowing researchers to account for uncertainty in network structure.

tools.name: COBRApy
tools.one_line_profile: Constraint-based modeling of metabolic networks in Python
tools.detailed_description: COBRApy is a comprehensive Python package for constraint-based modeling of metabolic networks. It supports FBA, FVA, gene deletion studies, and handles standard formats like SBML.

tools.name: The COBRA Toolbox
tools.one_line_profile: Constraint-Based Reconstruction and Analysis Toolbox for MATLAB
tools.detailed_description: The COBRA Toolbox is the industry-standard MATLAB suite for constraint-based reconstruction and analysis of biochemical networks, offering a vast array of algorithms for metabolic modeling.

tools.name: memote
tools.one_line_profile: Genome-scale metabolic model test suite
tools.detailed_description: Memote is a testing suite for genome-scale metabolic models. It provides a standardized set of tests to assess model quality, consistency, and annotation, generating detailed reports.

tools.name: SBML2Julia
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for translating SBML/PEtab models to Julia for ODE parameter optimization
tools.detailed_description: SBML2Julia translates biological models from SBML or PEtab formats into Julia for Mathematical Programming (JuMP) to perform parameter optimization tasks for ordinary differential equation (ODE) models.

tools.name: d3flux
tools.one_line_profile: D3.js-based visualization library for metabolic models
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that produces D3.js-based interactive visualizations of metabolic networks and flux distributions, designed to work with cobrapy models.

tools.name: dFBA
tools.one_line_profile: Dynamic Flux Balance Analysis implementation in Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for performing Dynamic Flux Balance Analysis (dFBA) to simulate the dynamic behavior of metabolic networks over time.

tools.name: GPRuler
tools.one_line_profile: Automated reconstruction of Gene-Protein-Reaction rules for metabolic networks
tools.detailed_description: A computational framework to automate the reconstruction process of Gene-Protein-Reaction (GPR) rules within metabolic networks based on gene lists and gene-reaction associations.

tools.name: sbml2hyb
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for SBML-compatible hybrid modelling of biological systems
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to facilitate hybrid modeling of biological systems, supporting models defined in the SBML format.

tools.name: pgp_reconstruction
tools.one_line_profile: Pathway-Guided Pruning for metabolic model reconstruction
tools.detailed_description: Implements the Pathway-Guided Pruning (PGP) algorithm for the reconstruction of genome-scale metabolic models.

tools.name: corda
tools.one_line_profile: Cost Optimization Reaction Dependency Assessment for model reconstruction
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of the CORDA (Cost Optimization Reaction Dependency Assessment) algorithm for reconstructing genome-scale metabolic models from experimental data.

tools.name: moccasin
tools.one_line_profile: Converter for MATLAB ODE models to SBML format
tools.detailed_description: MOCCASIN (Model ODE Converter for Creating Automated SBML Interoperability) translates basic ODE-based MATLAB models of biological processes into the standardized SBML format.

tools.name: SBMLImporter.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Import SBML models into Julia SciML ecosystem
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package to import SBML dynamic models into the SciML ecosystem, enabling simulation via Jump (Gillespie), SDE, and ODE solvers.

tools.name: spatial-model-editor
tools.one_line_profile: Editor and simulator for spatial bio-chemical reaction models
tools.detailed_description: A software tool for editing and simulating spatial bio-chemical reaction models, supporting SBML spatial extensions.

tools.name: Spatial_Simulator
tools.one_line_profile: Spatial model simulator using SBML
tools.detailed_description: A C++ simulator for executing spatial simulations based on SBML models, focusing on reaction-diffusion systems.

tools.name: DifferentiableMetabolism.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable constraint-based metabolic modeling in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package enabling differentiable constraint-based metabolic modeling, allowing for gradient-based optimization and integration with machine learning workflows.

tools.name: Escher.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization of metabolic models in Julia/Makie
tools.detailed_description: A Julia library for visualizing metabolic models and flux distributions using the Makie plotting ecosystem, inspired by the Escher web tool.

tools.name: AMAS
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic Model Annotation System for SBML models
tools.detailed_description: AMAS predicts and adds annotations to species and reactions in SBML models to improve model quality and interoperability.

tools.name: simplesbml
tools.one_line_profile: Simplified Python interface for creating SBML models
tools.detailed_description: A Python package that simplifies the process of building SBML models programmatically without requiring direct interaction with the complex libSBML API.

tools.name: DCcov
tools.one_line_profile: Drug repositioning using Flux Balance Analysis
tools.detailed_description: A computational tool for drug repositioning of single drugs and drug combinations utilizing Flux Balance Analysis (FBA) on metabolic models.

tools.name: chimera
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for genome-based metabolic network reconstruction
tools.detailed_description: An automated pipeline for the reconstruction, evaluation, and visualization of genome-scale metabolic networks.

tools.name: yaml2sbml
tools.one_line_profile: Converter for translating ODE models from YAML format to SBML standard
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool designed to convert Ordinary Differential Equation (ODE) models specified in a human-readable YAML format into the Systems Biology Markup Language (SBML), facilitating interoperability with other systems biology tools.

tools.name: Escher
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based visualization tool for metabolic pathways and gene regulatory networks
tools.detailed_description: A web-based tool for building, sharing, and embedding visualizations of metabolic pathways. It supports the visualization of flux balance analysis (FBA) data and integrates with COBRA models.

tools.name: GEMsembler
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for assembling and comparing Genome-Scale Metabolic Models (GEMs)
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool designed to facilitate the assembly and comparison of various types of Genome-Scale Metabolic Models (GEMs), supporting the reconstruction process in systems biology.
